data.headline: DOWNASDAQS&P 500RUSSELL 2000DOW - Stock Price Chart
bullets: Nvidia-fueled AI optimism and a new Meta chip partnership drive a broad semiconductor and software rally, with CDNS up 7%, SNPS up 3%, MU up 5.9%, and ADI up 6% premarket.
S&P 500 rises about 0.6% and Nasdaq gains 0.8% near record highs, while Dow and Russell 2000 lag with 0.3% advances.
PLTR trades higher, PANW softer as AI sector rotation continues to shape market leadership.
Investors digest resilient durable goods and housing data, supporting risk sentiment.
January FOMC minutes show a policy split but little near-term rate cut urgency, keeping two-cut pricing intact and nudging Treasury yields toward 4.1%.
The dollar firms and gold hovers near recent highs, while copper prices climb on global demand hopes.
MSG Entertainment gains on reports of a potential Knicks-Rangers split.
Traders focus on upcoming PCE inflation data and earnings from DoorDash and eBay amid ongoing AI-driven sector rotation and geopolitical developments.
